results.description: Following the fire in the Eurostar tunnel on Thursday night, Andrew Martin returns to the original rail and sea crossing to Paris
results.title: The return of the boat train to Paris

results.description: A small consolation for a middle-aged woman cycling from London to Brussels in three days is that Belgium is flat, right? Not true, says Julie Welch.
results.title: Are you made of the ride stuff?

results.description: Robin McKie climbed on a train in Brixton and 60 hours and several ham sandwiches later arrived in a spice-laden souk at the foot of the Atlas mountains.
results.title: Next stop Marrakesh...

results.description: The people behind easyJet and Yo! Sushi are about to open hotels. Whatever next? Even Ikea and Pret A Manger are considering entering the market, writes Caroline Roux.
results.title: Living in a box

results.description: If the dark days of January have left you craving blue skies, look no further for inspiration. Our panel of experts suggests the perfect winter getaways for our sun-starved readers

results.description: Legendary film critic Roger Ebert reminisces about the eccentric hotel on Jermyn Street that for 25 years was his sanctuary – but now faces demolition
results.title: Roger Ebert: Farewell to my London home

attachments.caption: Roger Ebert at the window of his room at the Eyrie Mansion. Photograph: Roger Ebert

results.description: Bromley is a large suburban town in south east London, England and the administrative headquarters of the London Borough of Bromley. It is located south east of Charing Cross and is one of the major metropolitan centres identified in the London Plan (...)
results.title: Bromley

results.description: Welling is a district in the London Borough of Bexley , South East London. It is a suburban development situated between Shooter's Hill and Bexleyheath north of the A2 road and 10.5 miles (16.9 km) east south-east of Charing Cross.  (...)
results.title: Welling
